_header: For head and saucefleme and wicked humors

HunHM64.First Lines:
ffor hed and sauce fleme & wickid humoursTake thes gresses of
                    bitter sauowrisWormode Sange fyveleuyd ggrasse and fumeterStampe and
                    gryndes to geders intere…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…If hit be drongken & mengid arightWithe the therde parte
                    of suger thryes in sevynnyghte
HunHM64.Note:
Written as prose, with red highlights for initials of each line; headed,
                    ‘ffor saunce fleme and wicked humours’.
HunHM64.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 244-6 (excerpts).
